title: Ferrero Travel Market showcases new releases at TFWA World Exhibition, Cannes - Snack Food & Wholesale Bakery
summary: Ferrero Travel Markets showcased new innovations at the TFWA World Exhibition in Cannes, focusing on gifting, expanding into the biscuit category with Kinderini, and demonstrating its commitment to sustainability. Highlights included Kinder Mix Koala with an AR experience, Kinder Chocolate Pencil Case, and Rocher Iconic Gift in a reusable tin, while Kinderini emphasizes family fun and La Biscotteria promotes sustainable packaging.
product_or_process: Kinderini, a new biscuit for families with young children, and Rocher Iconic Gift tin with a focus on reuse and upcycling.

title: London-based circular economy startup Reboxed® secures €1.8 million to help tackle e-waste - EU-Startups
summary: Reboxed®, a sustainable tech startup aiming to rehome 100 million electronic devices by 2030, has secured €1.8 million in seed funding. The company offers premium refurbished and pre-owned devices through a "like new" experience, focusing on quality and a circular approach to combat e-waste. The investment will be used to expand their team, technology, and brand reach to accelerate the move to a circular economy for retailers and businesses.
product_or_process: Refurbished and pre-owned devices and a 'like new' experience for purchasing them

title: Circular economy startup Reboxed secures £1.6m seed round - UKTN (UK Technology News
summary: Reboxed, a London-based startup, has raised £1.6m to combat e-waste by offering refurbished electronics and re-commerce services to brands. Their platform helps brands transition to a circular economy by embedding re-commerce solutions that distribute refurbished devices to customers. This investment will be used to expand the team, build technology, and scale the brand.

title: What is Bioeconomy and Why is it Important? - Ground Report
summary: The bioeconomy utilizes renewable biological resources to produce food, materials, and energy, aiming for sustainable development and reducing dependence on fossil fuels. It offers potential for economic growth through job creation and innovation across sectors like agriculture and forestry, while contributing to climate change mitigation and food security. The bioeconomy aligns with the UN's Sustainable Development Goals, particularly in areas like poverty alleviation, clean water, and sustainable industry.
